channel.title: Ivy League Free Courses
channel.description: Latest free courses from Ivy League universities

item.title: Terrible Swift Sword: Confederate Ascendency and Ultimate Defeat - Class 14
item.description: <class>Ivy_League_Course</class> <hash>b5f142c</hash> Explore the pivotal moments of Confederate military success and eventual downfall during the Civil War, examining their lasting impact on American society and constitutional framework.

item.title: Never Call Retreat: Military Turning Points and Why the North Won the Civil War - Class 15
item.description: <class>Ivy_League_Course</class> <hash>3c5f473</hash> Explore the pivotal military turning points of the Civil War and analyze the strategic factors that led to the Union's victory, examining the war's lasting impact on American society.

item.title: Plastic in Our Blood: Understanding Health Impacts of Microplastic Exposure
item.description: <class>Ivy_League_Course</class> <hash>c34f6ed</hash> Explore the alarming presence of microplastics in human bodies, their health implications, and our complex relationship with plastic pollution through expert insights and research findings.

item.title: Causes of the American Civil War: Slavery, States' Rights, and the Irrepressible Conflict - Class 13
item.description: <class>Ivy_League_Course</class> <hash>c634607</hash> Explore the complex historical debate over Civil War causation, examining the roles of slavery, states' rights, and political tensions in shaping America's deadliest conflict.

item.title: No Rights: Dred Scott, Bleeding Kansas, and the Impending Crisis of the Union - Class 11
item.description: <class>Ivy_League_Course</class> <hash>a17ae76</hash> Explore the pivotal events of Dred Scott, Bleeding Kansas, and the impending crisis leading to the Civil War. Gain insights into slavery's impact on American institutions and its enduring legacies.

item.title: John Brown's Holy War, 1860 Election, and the Secession Crisis - Class 12
item.description: <class>Ivy_League_Course</class> <hash>c5dd2f0</hash> Explore the pivotal events leading to the Civil War: John Brown's raid, the 1860 election, and the secession crisis. Gain insights into slavery's impact on American history and its enduring legacies.

item.title: Structure and Function of Argument: Introduction to Critical Thinking
item.description: <class>Ivy_League_Course</class> <hash>9f0544f</hash> Explore the underlying structures of everyday arguments and develop the tools to communicate effectively.

item.title: The Case for a Liberal Arts Education: Is It Worth the Investment?
item.description: <class>Ivy_League_Course</class> <hash>45afa1d</hash> Explore the value and relevance of liberal arts education in today's world, examining its benefits, challenges, and potential for personal and societal growth.

item.title: "Mexico Will Poison Us": War of Conquest, the Compromise, and Kansas-Nebraska - Class 10
item.description: <class>Ivy_League_Course</class> <hash>aee095c</hash> Explore the Mexican-American War's impact on slavery, the Compromise of 1850, and the Kansas-Nebraska Act in shaping American history and institutions.

item.title: The Psychology, Biology and Politics of Food - Lecture 6
item.description: <class>Ivy_League_Course</class> <hash>512adaa</hash> Explore the intricate connections between psychology, biology, and politics in relation to food systems and consumption patterns.
